intro: Cuphea laricoides, commonly known as the silverleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes other ornamental shrubs and flowering plants. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Cuphea laricoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
